page.title: 04THE TOWN PARK,TELFORD
page.content: {TELFORD TOWN PARK}is 180 hectares of open space in the centre of{TELFORD.}A large part of the park is now land- scaped but until the early 1970's it was derelict industrial land.The lakes are not natural and the mounds are mining spoil heaps about 100 years old Woodland has developed on these old sites and they now form a valuable {WILDLIFE HABITAT}and a major part of the landscape.The part of the park which is nearest the{TOWN CENTRE contains the formal{CHELSEA GARDENS,}a childrens play area, a band stand and the arena which is used for such annual events as Super Saturday and the Telford Games.Beside Randlay Lake is the open air amphitheatre. Wonderland is also here complete with Nursery rhyme and Fairy Tale houses. {Countryside Wardens}look after the park and help visitors with advice.
